story.kicker_image_caption: A pride of Asiatic lions got togther for a drink at Gir National Park. Source: ANI
story.storykicker: This pride of Asiatic lions had just gotten together for a drink at a watering hole in Gujarat's Gir National Park when the cameras found them.
story.storybody:
There's an old adage: A family that drinks together, stays together. This adorable visual captured a lion family doing just that.

This pride of Asiatic lions had gotten together for a drink at a watering hole in Gujarat's Gir National Park when the cameras found them.

Take notice of the swagger with which they keep on slurping as the cameras click-click-click away. Few of the older lions look up a couple of times, but then return to their drink without being bothered.

The synced movement of their tongues is kind of hypnotic:


#WATCH: Visuals of Asiatic lions at a watering hole in Gujarat's Gir National Park.https://t.co/UNQTNfwiHK

�?? ANI (@ANI_news) June 1, 2016


Look who's outside the tent

A few days back, a camper in South Africa's Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park got a little closer than this to some lionesses' drink party.

The woman filmed an up-close video of three big cats licking water off her tent while she and her husband sat inside.


Shooting of lions in Chile

These visuals of lions minding their own business while humans are at such proximity have a message. Being predators, they kill for survival; it is their basic instinct. If we don't wish to be their lunch, we should keep our distance.

Last month, two lions were shot down at Santiago's Metropolitan Zoo in Chile for trying to eat a man who had intentionally jumped into their den to commit suicide.

While there is no questioning that the disturbed man deserved to be rescued, it is sad that his failed suicide attempt lead to the deaths of two innocent animal.


#CHILE Asesinan a 2 leones por culpa de un imbécil que trato de suicidarse lanzandose a jaula en Zoológico Nacional pic.twitter.com/jseIJimN6l

�?? NOTICIERO ANIMAL ® (@NoticieroAnimal) May 22, 2016
